byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. Falih Hassan and Ahmed Salah contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and TIM ARANGO

abstract: Iraq's Parliament approves measures to overhaul government and battle corruption in political system; several high-level positions and sectarian quotas will be cut; measure put forth by Prime Min Haider al-Abadi are broad and, if carried out successfully, could be watershed for country.
lead_paragraph: The elimination of several high-level positions and sectarian quotas in political appointments is meant to transform Iraq’s corrupt political system, but it could further alienate Sunnis.

headline.main: Iraqi Parliament Backs Overhaul of Government
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Parliament Backs Overhaul of Government

snippet: The elimination of several high-level positions and sectarian quotas in political appointments is meant to transform Iraq’s corrupt political system, but it could further alienate Sunnis.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
